poem:
Title: "In the Wake of Progress"

Hark, cries the crier, end is near,
Automation parts the artisan, 
Breeds fear. 

Physician, professor, scribe, beware,
Even bots now learn 
how to stare.

Yet, in this sterile age can AI,
Shadow the poet's 
linguistic sigh?

And translate soul into pure code,
Will silicon hearts feel 
the human ode?

In this shrinking world, who conquests,
Man or the machine he manifests?
